intro: Sedum laxum subsp. laxum, commonly known as the looseleaf stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features fleshy, blue-green leaves that are arranged in a loose, spreading rosette. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped yellow flowers during the summer months. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soil, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its adaptability to harsh conditions makes it a popular choice for landscaping in arid climates.
